Package arcade.potts.env.location

Class PottsLocation

  • java.lang.Object
    • arcade.potts.env.location.PottsLocation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Location
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PottsLocation2D, PottsLocation3D, PottsLocations
    public abstract class PottsLocation
extends java.lang.Object
implements Location
    Abstract implementation of Location for potts models.

    PottsLocation objects manage the a list of associated Voxel objects that comprise the location. These voxels are represented as an array in the Potts layer and the two representations are kept in sync.

    Concrete implementations of PottsLocation manage the dimensionality of the voxels.

    PottsLocation also provides several general static methods for manipulating voxel lists:

    • Split voxel list along a given direction
    • Connect voxels to ensure that each list contains connected voxels
    • Balance voxels between two lists to ensure they have a similar number of voxels
    • Check voxels for connectedness

      • split

        public Location split​(ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random)
        Splits location voxels into two approximately equal lists.

        The location is split along the direction with the shortest diameter. The lists of locations are guaranteed to be connected, and generally will be balanced in size. One of the splits is assigned to the current location and the other is returned.

        Parameters:
        random - the seeded random number generator
        Returns:
        a location with the split voxels

      • split

        public Location split​(ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random,
                      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> offsets)
        Splits location voxels into two lists with given offset.

        The location is split at the point specified by offsets along the direction with the shortest diameter. The lists of locations are guaranteed to be connected. One of the splits is assigned to the current location and the other is returned.

        Parameters:
        random - the seeded random number generator
        offsets - the percentage offset in each direction for split point
        Returns:
        a location with the split voxels

      • split

        public Location split​(ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random,
                      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> offsets,
                      PottsEnums.Direction direction,
                      java.lang.Double probability)
        Splits location voxels into two lists with given offset, direction, and probability.

        The location is split at the point specified by offsets along the given direction. The lists of locations are guaranteed to be connected. One of the splits is assigned to the current location and the other is returned.

        Parameters:
        random - the seeded random number generator
        offsets - the percentage offset in each direction for split point
        direction - the direction of the split
        probability - the probability to decide which split to return
        Returns:
        a location with the split voxels

      • split

        public Location split​(ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random,
                      Plane plane,
                      java.lang.Double probability)
        Splits location voxels into two lists.

        The location is split along the provided plane. One of the splits is assigned to the current location and the other is returned with the given probability.

        If the plane of division is through the center of the location, the resulting lists are guaranteed to be connected, and generally will be balanced in size. If the plane of division is not through the center of the location, the resulting lists are guaranteed to be connected but will not necessarily be balanced in size.

        Parameters:
        random - the seeded random number generator
        plane - the plane of the split
        probability - the probability to decide which split to return
        Returns:
        a location with the split voxels

      • getCenter

        public Voxel getCenter()
        Gets the voxel at the center of the location.

        The center voxel is not guaranteed to exist in the location. If the center voxel must exist, use adjust() to get the closest voxel that exists.

        Returns:
        the center voxel, returns null if there are no voxels

      • getOffset

        public Voxel getOffset​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> offsets)
        Calculates the voxel at specified offsets from location bounds.

        The voxel position is calculated as percentage offsets using the minimum and maximum bounds of the current location in the X, Y, and Z dimensions. Offsets should be passed as percentages in the range [0, 100]. Offsets may be given as one percentage N1 (interpreted as [x = N, y = N, z = N]), two percentages N1 and N2 (interpreted as [x = N1, y = N2, z = 0]), or three percentages N1, N2, and N3 (interpreted as [x = N1, y = N2, z = N3]).

        For example, offsets of [50, 50, 50] will return the voxel located 50% between the minimum and maximum in each direction. Note that [50, 50, 50] is not necessarily equivalent to the center of the location, which is calculated as the arithmetic mean in each direction. To get the center, use getCenter() instead.

        The voxel is not guaranteed to exist in the location. If the voxel must exist, use adjust() to get the closest voxel that exists.

        Parameters:
        offsets - the percentage offset in each direction for split point
        Returns:
        the offset voxel, returns null if there are no voxels

      • getCentroid

        public double[] getCentroid()
        Gets the centroid of the location.

        Note that centroid positions may not be integer values. If a specific center voxel is needed, use getCenter() instead.

        Returns:
        the location centroid

      • separateVoxels

        Location separateVoxels​(java.util.ArrayList<Voxel> voxelsA,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Voxel> voxelsB,
                        ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random)
        Separates the voxels in the list between this location and a new location.
        Parameters:
        voxelsA - the list of voxels for this location
        voxelsB - the list of voxels for the split location
        random - the seeded random number generator
        Returns:
        a Location object with split voxels

      • splitVoxels

        static void splitVoxels​(Plane plane,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Voxel> voxels,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Voxel> voxelsA,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Voxel> voxelsB,
                        ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random)
        Splits the voxels in the location into two lists along a given plane.

        The voxels are split into two lists based on their position relative to the plane. Voxels on the plane are randomly assigned to one of the lists.

        Parameters:
        plane - the plane to split the voxels along
        voxels - the list of voxels to split
        voxelsA - list of voxels on side of plane the opposite the normal
        voxelsB - list of voxels on side of plane the same as the normal
        random - the seeded random number generator

      • connectVoxels

        static void connectVoxels​(java.util.ArrayList<Voxel> voxelsA,
                          java.util.ArrayList<Voxel> voxelsB,
                          PottsLocation location,
                          ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random)
        Connects voxels in the splits.

        Checks that the voxels in each split are connected. If not, then move the unconnected voxels into the other split.

        Parameters:
        voxelsA - the list for the first half of the split
        voxelsB - the list for the second half of the split
        location - the location instance
        random - the seeded random number generator

      • balanceVoxels

        static void balanceVoxels​(java.util.ArrayList<Voxel> voxelsA,
                          java.util.ArrayList<Voxel> voxelsB,
                          PottsLocation location,
                          ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random)
        Balances voxels in the splits.

        Checks that the number of voxels in each split are within a certain difference. If not, then add voxels from the larger split into the smaller split such that both splits are still connected. For small split sizes, there may not be a valid split that is both connected and within the difference; in these cases, connectedness is prioritized and the splits are returned not balanced.

        Parameters:
        voxelsA - the list for the first half of the split
        voxelsB - the list for the second half of the split
        location - the location instance
        random - the seeded random number generator

      • checkVoxels

        static java.util.ArrayList<Voxel> checkVoxels​(java.util.ArrayList<Voxel> voxels,
                                              PottsLocation location,
                                              ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random,
                                              boolean update)
        Checks voxels in the list for connectedness.

        All the connected voxels from a random starting voxel are found and marked as visited. If there are no remaining unvisited voxels, then the list is fully connected. If there are, then the smaller of the visited or unvisited lists is returned.

        Some voxel lists may have more than one unconnected section.

        Parameters:
        voxels - the list of voxels
        location - the location instance
        random - the seeded random number generator
        update - true if list should be updated, false otherwise
        Returns:
        a list of unconnected voxels, null if list is connected
